data.Title: Bing Launches Generative AI Search Experience
data.Description: Microsoft is rolling out Bing generative search, an AI-powered feature similar to Google's AI Overviews, to enhance search results with AI-generated summaries and a more dynamic user interface.

data.Title: Apple Maps Launches Web Beta
data.Description: Apple has released a web-based beta version of Apple Maps, compatible with major browsers like Safari, Chrome, and Edge, expanding access to its mapping service beyond Apple devices.

data.Title: Reddit Blocks Bing and Other Search Engines, Except Google
data.Description: Reddit has updated its robots.txt file, restricting access for search engines and AI crawlers, including Microsoft Bing and DuckDuckGo, while maintaining access for Google Search.

data.Title: Google to Test Ads in AI Overviews
data.Description: Google has announced plans to experiment with incorporating advertisements within its AI Overviews, aiming to monetize the AI-powered search feature while providing relevant promotions to users.

data.Title: Google's Q2 Earnings Show Growth Driven by Search and Cloud
data.Description: Alphabet, Google's parent company, reported strong Q2 earnings, with revenue exceeding expectations and significant growth in search and cloud computing, although YouTube ad revenue fell short of projections.

data.Title: Google Third-Party Cookies in Chrome to Remain
data.Description: Reversing previous announcements, Google has confirmed that it will not be deprecating third-party cookies in its Chrome browser, opting instead to continue developing privacy-preserving alternatives.
